title: Disney CEO Bob Iger Resigns From Apple Board as Streaming Competition Ramps Up
text:
Apple dropped some news as investors headed out for the weekend: Bob Iger resigned from its board of directors. Iger, 68, had served on the iPhone-maker’s board since 2011.

With Apple (ticker: AAPL) launching an on-demand streaming service called Apple+ on Nov. 1, the conflict of interest for Walt Disney (DIS) CEO Iger clearly became too great. The entertainment giant is also leaning into direct-to-consumer streaming this fall, with its service Disney+ debuting on Nov. 12. Iger had been recusing himself from related discussions.

...
description: Apple is launching a streaming service in November, making it a direct competitor to Disney’s service that is set to launch the same month.
